item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, 'Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous?' Actually, who are you not to be? You are a child of God. Your playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine, as children do. We were born to make manifest the glory of God that is within us. It's not just in some of us; it's in everyone. And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Joycelyn add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Denis Waitley
item.description: "The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence." -- Denis Waitley

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Heraclitus
item.description: "Time is a game played beautifully by children." -- Heraclitus

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well." -- Aristotle

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Plato
item.description: "There is truth in wine and children" -- Plato

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Charles Caleb Colton
item.description: "If you cannot inspire a woman with love of you, fill her above the brim with love of herself ~ all that runs over will be yours." -- Charles Caleb Colton

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description:
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
[misquote of a letter about wine, see quotes/831031]" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Joycelyn add a quote by Martin Luther
item.description: "Beer is made by men, wine by God." -- Martin Luther
